alert.note: Alert for Clinton; Essex (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued February 18 at 11:05AM EST until February 18 at 12:45PM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING FOR AN ICE JAM REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON FOR SOUTH CENTRAL CLINTON AND NORTH CENTRAL ESSEX COUNTIES... At 1105 AM EST, Clinton County Emergency Management reports that the ice jam has moved downstream of Ausable Forks, and is approaching Clintonville. The flash flood threat continues along the Ausable River due to an ice jam through early this afternoon. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding from an ice jam. SOURCE...Emergency Management reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas near the ice jam. Downstream of Ausable Forks, including Clintonville and Keesville. This includes the following streams and drainages... The Ausable River, East Branch Ausable River. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay away from areas of high water and move to higher ground.
